intro: Villadia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan villadia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are usually ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Villadia guatemalensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
